House Banking, Finance, and Urban Affairs

official_title: A bill to provide that the Exchange Stabilization Fund shall not be available for payment of administrative expenses; and for other purposes.

summary.as: House agreed to Senate amendment with amendment
summary.text: (House agreed to certain Senate amendment with an amendment) Amends the Gold Reserve Act of 1934 to make the Exchange Stabilization Fund unavailable for payment of administrative expenses. Authorizes the Secretary of the Treasury to appoint personnel to carry out the international affairs functions of the Department of the Treasury and to provide allowances and benefits to such personnel. Sets conditions on personnel appointments. Makes United States representatives appointed to the African Development Fund eligible for benefits afforded civil service employees of the United States. Authorizes the appropriation of $24,000,000 for fiscal year 1979 to carry out the international affairs functions of the Department of the Treasury. Requires the Secretary of the Treasury to report monthly to Congress a detailed financial statement on the stabilization fund established under the Gold Reserve Act of 1934.

titles.title: A bill to provide that the Exchange Stabilization Fund shall not be available for payment of administrative expenses; and for other purposes.
